writeups.title: Cap
writeups.description: Complete Linux server compromise through access control failure, plaintext credential capture, and privilege escalation via misconfigured capability.

writeups.title: Lame
writeups.description: Linux machine with Samba 3.0.20 vulnerable to RCE (CVE-2007-2447), allowing direct root shell without authentication via command injection in the username field.

writeups.title: Nibbles
writeups.description: Linux server with Nibbleblog 4.0.3 vulnerable to arbitrary file upload via default credentials, escalating to root through misconfigured sudo permission.

writeups.title: Blue
writeups.description: Blue, while possibly the most simple machine on Hack The Box, demonstrates the severity of the EternalBlue exploit, which has been used in multiple large-scale ransomware and crypto-mining attacks since it was leaked publicly.

writeups.title: Mr Robot CTF
writeups.description: Mr Robot CTF is a vulnerable Linux machine designed to teach fundamental penetration testing skills through a pop-culture themed challenge. The machine simulates a real-world scenario where attackers must enumerate services, exploit web vulnerabilities, and escalate privileges to achieve root access.

writeups.title: Jerry
writeups.description: Jerry is an easy-difficulty Windows machine that showcases how to exploit Apache Tomcat, leading to an NT Authority|SYSTEM shell, thus fully compromising the target.
